001package imagingbook.lib.ij;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
005import java.util.List;
006
007import ij.IJ;
008import ij.gui.Overlay;
009import ij.gui.Roi;
010import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
011import imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
012import imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
013
014/**
015 * Defines a subclass of ImageJ's {@link Overlay} class
016 * that accepts elements of a specific type {@link T}.
017 * This (abstract) class cannot be instantiated directly but
018 * is supposed to be used as the superclass for specific
019 * overlay types, e.g., for displaying corners, SIFT markers etc.
020 * (e.g., see {@link imagingbook.pub.sift.util.SiftOverlay}).
021 * In the simplest case, the concrete subclass just needs to implement the method 
022 * {@link #makeRoi(Object)}, which is only concerned with geometry.
023 * Stroke width and color are handled uniformly by this class ({@link CustomOverlay}).
024 * The coordinates of added {@link ShapeRoi} instances are automatically 
025 * shifted by a <strong>half-pixel distance</strong> (0.5, 0.5) 
026 * to display integer points at the associated pixel centers.
027 * <br>
028 * Note: ImageJ draws all ROI types except {@link ShapeRoi} with a half-pixel offset.
029 * This class redefines the methods {@link Overlay#add(Roi)} 
030 * to perform the half-pixel shift.
031 * <br>
032 * TODO: Merge this with {@link ShapeOverlayAdapter} and {@link ColoredStroke} (which is simpler).
033 * <br>
034 * Note: This is experimental code - do NOT rely on it!
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2020/10/04
038 *
039 * @param <T> type of elements allowed to be added to this overlay
040 */
041public abstract class CustomOverlay<T> extends Overlay {
042        
043        public static Color DefaultStrokeColor = Color.gray;
044        public static double DefaultStrokeWidth = 0.25;
045        
046        private Color strokeColor = DefaultStrokeColor;
047        private double strokeWidth = DefaultStrokeWidth;
048        
049        protected CustomOverlay() {
050        }
051        
052        protected CustomOverlay(Color strokeColor, double strokeWidth) {
053                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
054                this.strokeWidth = strokeWidth;
055        }
056        
057        // -----------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        /**
060         * This method, which must be implemented by any subclass
061         * of {@link CustomOverlay},
062         * defines how an instance of type {@link T} is 
063         * converted to an {@link Roi} object.
064         * Called by {@link #addItem(Object)}.
065         * 
066         * @param item an instance of type {@link T} to be added to the overlay
067         * @return the resulting {@link Roi} object
068         */
069        public abstract Roi makeRoi(T item);
070        
071        // Experimental convenience method to specify color/width individually:
072        public Roi makeRoi(T item, Color strokeColor, double strokeWidth) {
073                Roi roi = makeRoi(item);
074                roi.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
075                roi.setStrokeWidth(strokeWidth);
076                return roi;
077        }
078        
079        
080        // -----------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        @Override  // deactivated method in super class:
083        public void setStrokeColor(Color strokeColor) {
084                IJ.log(CustomOverlay.class.getSimpleName() + ": setStrokeColor() has no effect, use strokeColor()!");
085        }
086        
087        @Override  // deactivated method in super class:
088        public void setStrokeWidth(Double strokeWidth) {
089                IJ.log(CustomOverlay.class.getSimpleName() + ": setStrokeWidth() has no effect, use strokeWidth()!");
090        }
091        
092        // -----------------------------------------------------------
093        
094        /**
095         * Sets the stroke color for all items subsequently added to this overlay.
096         * The stroke color can be changed any time between insertions.
097         * Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with 
098         * the existing {@link Overlay#setStrokeColor(Color)} method,
099         * which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
100         * @param strokeColor the new stroke color to be used
101         */
102        public void strokeColor(Color strokeColor) {
103                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         * Returns the overlay's current stroke color.
108         * Useful for modifying the value temporarily and then reinstating the
109         * previous value.
110         * @return as described
111         */
112        public Color getStrokeColor() {
113                return this.strokeColor;
114        }
115        
116
117        
118        /**
119         * Sets the stroke width for all items subsequently added to this overlay.
120         * The stroke width can be changed any time between insertions.
121         * Uncommonly named (like a directive) to avoid confusion with 
122         * the existing {@link Overlay#setStrokeWidth(Double)} method,
123         * which modifies all elements currently contained in the overlay.
124         * @param strokeWidth the new stroke width to be used
125         */
126        public void strokeWidth(double strokeWidth) {
127                this.strokeWidth = strokeWidth;
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Returns the overlay's current stroke width.
132         * Useful for modifying the value temporarily and then reinstating the
133         * previous value.
134         * @return as described
135         */
136        public double getStrokeWidth() {
137                return this.strokeWidth;
138        }
139        
140        // -----------------------------------------------------------
141        
142        /**
143         * Adds an ImageJ {@link Roi} instance to this overlay.
144         * A half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI is of type {@link ShapeRoi}.
145         * Should be used instead of {@link Overlay#add(Roi)}.
146         * 
147         * @param roi the ROI to be added 
148         */
149        public void addRoi(Roi roi) {
150                this.addRoi(roi, false);
151        }
152        
153        
154        /**
155         * Adds an ImageJ {@link Roi} instance to this overlay.
156         * Optionally, a half-pixel shift is applied if the passed ROI 
157         * is not drawn with a half-pixel shift by ImageJ.
158         * Does not apply the overlay's current stroke width and color settings.
159         * This method should be used instead of {@link Overlay#add(Roi)}.
160         * 
161         * @param roi the ROI to be added 
162         * @param shiftHalfPixel if set true a half-pixel shift is added to each coordinate
163         */
164        public void addRoi(Roi roi, boolean shiftHalfPixel) {
165                //IJ.log(roi.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": " + drawsWithHalfPixelShift(roi));
166                // roi.setDrawOffset(true); // does nothing
167                // add half-pixel shift only to ShapeRoi instances (other ROI types are displayed with offset)
168                if (shiftHalfPixel) { // && !drawsWithHalfPixelShift(roi)) { // && roi instanceof ShapeRoi) {
169                        Rectangle2D r = roi.getFloatBounds();
170                        roi.setLocation(r.getX() + 0.5, r.getY() + 0.5);
171                }
172                super.add(roi);
173    }
174        
175//      /**
176//       * Checks if ImageJ automatically draws the particular roi instance with a half-pixel
177//       * shift or not.
178//       * Note that this is handled inconsistently in ImageJ and probably a bug -
179//       * all roi classes should have the same behavior.
180//       * Known ROI-types that do NOT half-pixel shift are
181//       * {@link ShapeRoi} and certain kinds of 
182//       * {@link Line} (namely {@link Roi.POLYGON}, {@link Roi.FREELINE}, {@link Roi.ANGLE}).
183//       *
184//       * @param roi
185//       * @return
186//       */
187//      public static boolean drawsWithHalfPixelShift(Roi roi) {
188//              return true;
189//              return
190//                      roi instanceof Line ||
191//                      roi instanceof Arrow ||
192//                      roi instanceof PointRoi ||
193//                      roi instanceof PolygonRoi && ((PolygonRoi)roi).getType() == Roi.POLYLINE ||
194//                      roi instanceof PolygonRoi && ((PolygonRoi)roi).getType() == Roi.FREELINE 
195//                      ;
196//      }
197        
198        // -----------------------------------------------------------
199        
200        /**
201         * Adds a single item of type {@link T} to this overlay.
202         * Applies the overlay's current stroke width and color settings.
203         * @param item an instance of type {@link T}
204         */
205        public void addItem(T item) {
206                Roi roi = makeRoi(item);
207                roi.setStrokeWidth(this.strokeWidth);
208                roi.setStrokeColor(this.strokeColor);
209                this.addRoi(roi);
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Convenience method.
214         * Adds all items of type {@link T} in the supplied list to this overlay,
215         * using the same graphics (color, stroke width) settings.
216         * @param items a list of instances of type {@link T}
217         */
218        public void addItems(List<T> items) {
219                for(T item : items) {
220                        this.addItem(item);
221                }
222        }
223        
224        // -----------------------------------------------------------
225        
226        public void addToOverlay(Overlay otherOverlay) {
227                Roi[] rois = this.toArray();
228                for (Roi r : rois) {
229                        otherOverlay.add(r);
230                }
231        }
232
233}
